business_hypothesis: Cancellations are a primary source of revenue leakage: canceled shipments account for a disproportionate share of un-invoiced or delayed charges.
science_hypothesis: canceled (boolean) is strongly negatively correlated with invoiced_flag (Pearson r ≤ -0.60) and canceled-associated total_charges constitute a non-trivial fraction (>5%) of aggregate monthly total_charges; canceled is a significant negative predictor in linear/logit models (effect size > 0.4 standardized, p < 0.001).
null_case: Canceled shipments are random noise with respect to invoice recognition: correlation between canceled and invoiced_flag is |r| < 0.10, canceled-associated charges represent <1% of monthly total_charges, and canceled is non-significant in predictive models (p > 0.10).

validation_methods.execution_plan: Calculate monthly sums: total_charges attributable to canceled shipments, share_of_monthly_total = sum(total_charges where canceled=Y)/sum(total_charges all). Also compute P(invoiced_flag=Y | canceled=Y) and compare to canceled=N. The detector passes if canceled-associated share_of_monthly_total ≥ 5% OR P(invoiced_flag=Y | canceled=Y) is at least 30 percentage points lower than for canceled=N with p < 0.01.

Segment by billing_user_id and company_id and compute per-segment canceled-charge rate and contribution to total canceled dollar value; rank segments and report concentration (top decile share). The scanner passes if the top 10% of billing_user_id or company_id segments account for ≥ 50% of canceled charge value, indicating targeted remediation will have outsized impact.

Use matched propensity-score matching or difference-in-differences (if a policy change exists) to estimate the causal impact of cancellation on invoiced_flag and on recognized charge dollars, reporting average treatment effect and p-values. The referee passes if cancellation reduces probability of invoicing by ≥ 0.40 (40 percentage points) with p < 0.01 and effect is robust to matching and bootstrap (95% CI not containing zero).
